qas.question: What term was coined when Greece left the eurozone?
What is Germany's position on wether or not Greece should be in the eurozone?

answers.text: If the worst comes to the worst, priority should be given to the euro's stability.

qas.question: As one of the financial powers, has Germany ever tried to force the crisis states into leaving the eurozone?
Which eurozone country has the biggest need for financial reform?
What term was forbidden when Greece left the eurozone?

plausible_answers.text: If the worst comes to the worst, priority should be given to the euro's stability

qas.question: What is Spain's position on whether or not Greece should be outside the eurozone?
Which eurozone country has the smallest need for financial reform?
What country is least financially stable?

context: This has led to public discussions if Greece, Portugal, and even Italy would be better off leaving the eurozone to regain economical and financial stability if they would not implement reforms to strengthen their competitiveness as part of the eurozone in time. <a3_0>Greece<a3_0/> had the greatest need for reforms but also most problems to implement those, so the Greek exit, also called "<a0_0><b4_0>Grexit<b4_0/><a0_0/>", has been widely discussed. <b7_0>Germany<b7_0/>, as a large and financially stable state being in the focus to be asked to guarantee or repay other states debt, has <a2_0>never pushed those exits<a2_0/>. Their position is to keep <b6_0>Greece<b6_0/> within the eurozone, but not at any cost. <a1_0><b5_0>If the worst comes to the worst, priority should be given to the euro's stability<b5_0/>.
